text: The laboratory must have emergency safety facilities such as a sprinkler system and eyewash stations.
Staff should only wear gloves when they have skin lesions or rashes on their hands
Special safety equipment such as biosafety cabinets must be used
Staff should wear work clothes and safety glasses during experiments
label: A

C
D

question: Question: Which of the following is NOT an objective of laboratory biosafety protection?

text: Ensuring the surrounding environment is not polluted by them
Ensuring other laboratory staff are not contaminated by experimental subjects
Protecting the experimenter from contamination by experimental subjects

C
D

question: Question: Which of the following statements regarding the comparison between moist heat sterilization and dry heat sterilization is incorrect?

text: Moist heat sterilization is generally more effective and more commonly used than dry heat sterilization.
During moist heat sterilization, proteins with higher water content are more likely to denature and coagulate.
Dry heat sterilization has stronger penetration and faster conduction than moist heat sterilization.

In moist heat sterilization, steam has latent heat, which, when it contacts the items being sterilized, can condense into water and release latent heat, rapidly increasing the temperature and enhancing the sterilization effect.
label: A
B
C
D
